original_data.question: A 16-year-old patient presents to the physician’s office with an absence of menstruations. Her last period was 6 months ago. Since almost a year and a half ago, she intentionally restricted her diet at the expense of carbohydrates, exercised intensively, and lost 18.0 kg (39.7 lb). She had her menarche at the age of 12 and menstruated normally until last year. She is not sexually active. On physical examination, the vital signs include blood pressure 100/60 mm Hg, heart rate 55/min, respiratory rate 12/min, and temperature 35.9°C (96.6°F). Her weight is 55.0 kg (121.3 lb), and her height is 166 cm (5 ft 5 in). Physical examination reveals the good development of muscles and decreased adiposity. A bone scan shows decreased calcium mineral deposits. Which statement about this patient’s condition is correct?

options.B: Decreased adiposity contributes to hypoestrogenemia in this patient
options.C: The patient is likely to have decreased blood estrogen concentration due to increased liver metabolism
options.D: The patient should be checked for hyperthyroidism because such extensive lipolysis is likely to result from thyroid hyperfunction

model_response:
The patient has anorexia nervosa. Restricted food intake, decreased adiposity, and excessive exercise result in low estrogen production. The patient’s amenorrhea is most likely due to low estrogen levels. The low estrogen levels are associated with low levels of LH and FSH. The low estrogen levels are due to low GnRH levels, which are due to low leptin levels. Leptin is a hormone produced in adipose tissue that stimulates the production of GnRH. Hypoestrogenemia results in low bone mineral density. The patient’s low body weight and low leptin levels result in low levels of LH, FSH, and GnRH. The low levels of LH and FSH result in low estrogen levels. The low estrogen levels result in low leptin levels. The low leptin levels result in low GnRH levels. The low GnRH levels result in low LH and FSH levels. The low bone mineral density results from low estrogen levels. The low bone mineral density increases the risk of fractures. The patient’s low body weight and low leptin levels result in low levels of LH, FSH, and GnRH. The low levels of LH and FSH result in low estrogen levels. The low estrogen levels result in low leptin levels. The low leptin levels result in low GnRH levels. The low GnRH levels result in low LH and FSH levels. The low bone mineral density results from low estrogen levels. The low bone mineral density increases the risk of fractures.

Answer: OPTION B IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
The room or rooms in which the physician and staff provide patient care. The offices include all rooms in the physician's office suite.
Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.

The periodic shedding of the ENDOMETRIUM and associated menstrual bleeding in the MENSTRUAL CYCLE of humans and primates. Menstruation is due to the decline in circulating PROGESTERONE, and occurs at the late LUTEAL PHASE when LUTEOLYSIS of the CORPUS LUTEUM takes place.

The periodic shedding of the ENDOMETRIUM and associated menstrual bleeding in the MENSTRUAL CYCLE of humans and primates. Menstruation is due to the decline in circulating PROGESTERONE, and occurs at the late LUTEAL PHASE when LUTEOLYSIS of the CORPUS LUTEUM takes place.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.
Regular course of eating and drinking adopted by a person or animal.

A class of organic compounds composed of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen in a ratio of Cn(H2O)n. The largest class of organic compounds, including STARCH; GLYCOGEN; CELLULOSE; POLYSACCHARIDES; and simple MONOSACCHARIDES.
Parted with; no longer held or possessed; incapable of being recovered or regained.
The first MENSTRUAL CYCLE marked by the initiation of MENSTRUATION.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.

The periodic shedding of the ENDOMETRIUM and associated menstrual bleeding in the MENSTRUAL CYCLE of humans and primates. Menstruation is due to the decline in circulating PROGESTERONE, and occurs at the late LUTEAL PHASE when LUTEOLYSIS of the CORPUS LUTEUM takes place.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
A response indicating that an individual is or was sexually active.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.
Actions performed to measure temperature, pulse, respirations, and blood pressure
PRESSURE of the BLOOD on the ARTERIES and other BLOOD VESSELS.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
The number of times the HEART VENTRICLES contract per unit of time, usually per minute.
The rate of breathing (inhalation and exhalation) measured within in a unit time, usually expressed as breaths per minute.
The measure of the level of heat of a human or animal.
The mass or quantity of heaviness of an individual. It is expressed by units of pounds or kilograms.
The vertical measurement or distance from the base to the top of an object; the vertical dimension of extension.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.
Contractile tissue that produces movement in animals.
A subjective response indicating that something is or has decreased.

A status with BODY WEIGHT that is grossly above the recommended standards, usually due to accumulation of excess FATS in the body. The standards may vary with age, sex, genetic or cultural background. In the BODY MASS INDEX, a BMI greater than 30.0 kg/m2 is considered obese, and a BMI greater than 40.0 kg/m2 is considered morbidly obese (MORBID OBESITY).
A nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism.
A subjective response indicating that something is or has decreased.
Having calcium deposited on or in an anatomic structure.
A verbal and/or written message that asserts, affirms, or declares something.
A description of the physiological status of a patient.
